awd_titl_txt: U.S.-Korea Cooperative Research:  Subsurface Construction,  Resulting Ground Movements, and Protection of the Built     Environment
awd_abstract_narration: Cording  9722877    This award supports a three-year collaborative research  project between Dr. Edward Cording of the University of  Illinois and Dr. Hakmoon Kim of the University of Dankook in  Seoul, Korea on "Subsurface Construction, Resulting Ground  Movements, and Protection of the Built Environment."  The  project will involve 1) large-scale modeling, 2) collection  and analysis of field data, 3) numerical analysis, and 4)  development of guidelines and recommendations related to  ground movement and building damage.  The study will benefit  from data on the more than 100 construction-related  excavations currently underway in Seoul.    Excavations and tunnels are constructed adjacent to and  beneath thousands of buildings each year, and with each  instance, there is the possibility of damage to structures.  With ever increasing demands being placed on limited urban  space, subsurface construction projects will continue to  increase.  This research effort will combine the expertise,  facilities and data of the American and Korean research  groups to assess how best to deal with potential damage to  structures due to nearby subsurface construction.  ***
org_div_long_name: Office of International Science and Engineering
